body.name: Baby Wipes, Pampers Aqua Pure Sensitive Water Baby Diaper Wipes, Hypoallergenic and Unscented, 56 Count (Pack of 12)
features: Pampers Aqua Pure wipes are made with 99% pure water for our simplest formula
Includes 1% dermatologically tested cleansers and PH-balancing ingredients to help protect baby's delicate skin
Free of alcohols*, dyes, parabens, and fragrances *No ethanol or drying alcohol
Made with premium cotton for a soft and gentle clean
Gentle enough for bottoms, hands, and sensitive faces
A baby registry must have for expecting mothers
body.description: Includes: 12 Pampers Aqua Pure baby wipes 1x Pop-Top (56 ct), all bundled together for you

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Thick and Gentle As mild and gentle as using a washcloth and water, Sensitive wipes are ideal for the most sensitive baby skin. pH Balancing Made with simple, gentle ingredients, Sensitive wipes contain a touch of pH balancing lotion to help keep your baby’s skin healthy by maintaining skin’s natural pH One-Wipe Pop-Top Nothing is more frustrating than reaching for a wipe and getting three or four. That’s why our one-wipe pop-top is designed to help ensure you only get what you want. Pair with Swaddlers Diapers To help keep your baby’s skin dry and healthy, we recommend pairing Sensitive wipes with Pampers Swaddlers—our softest diapers made with our BreatheFree Liner that pulls wetness away from skin

Compare Our Wipes 0% alcohol/parabens derma-tested 1-wipe pop-top fragrance free for sensitive skin 0% alcohol/parabens derma-tested 1-wipe pop-top fragrance free for sensitive skin 0% alcohol/parabens derma-tested 1-wipe pop-top fragrance free for sensitive skin 0% alcohol/parabens derma-tested 1-wipe pop-top fragrance free for sensitive skin

Our Commitment Caring for babies is in our DNA. Our Pampers Bright Beginnings programs enable healthy development and early success for babies and families through education, hospital partnerships, and donations March of Dimes Partnership Pampers is proud to support the March of Dimes in giving every baby a fighting chance. We help provide our smallest diapers to the 1 million babies born before 28-week gestational age each year Sustainability Pampers cares for every baby and the planet they grow up in. We maintain zero manufacturing to landfill across all our plants and are committed to 100% renewable electricity by 2030 Community Donations Through ongoing donation efforts and partnerships with organizations like Feeding America and Matthew 25, Pampers strives to help babies get the bright beginnings they deserve Changing Table Access 9 out of 10 dads have used a public restroom that lacks a changing table. As part of our “Love the Change” campaign, we’re providing 5,000 changing tables for men’s restrooms across North America Hospital Support Proud to be the #1 choice of U.S. hospitals for nearly 50 years, we partner with nurses to develop skin-protecting products and support nursing education—all to help baby’s healthy development

Are Pampers wipes safe for my newborn baby? Yes! Babies' health and safety are our first priority at Pampers with our hypoallergenic products that are free of parabens and latex. Our wipes are safe and are clinically proven for sensitive skin. Dermatologist approved Are these wipes flushable? No. Our baby wipes are thick and gentle and are not designed to be flushed Which diaper should I use with Pampers Sensitive baby wipes? We recommend using Pampers Swaddlers diapers with Pampers Sensitive wipes together for healthy skin. Pampers Swaddlers diapers are softer and made with our BreatheFree Liner that provides breathability and pulls wetness away from the skin How does pH affect my baby's skin? Urine and bowel movements have pH levels that vary from baby's skin and are further affected by diet and health. When higher or lower pH levels contact skin, they can cause irritation. To help prevent irritation, pH must be balanced or neutralized Do Pampers wipes come with a pop-top? Yes! Pampers Sensitive wipes are available with either a pop-top or refill pack which can be used in wipes containers. Our pop-tops come with a one-wipe dispensing lid so you only get the wipes you need

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wipes efficiently, no smell, better than Huggies, doesn’t fall apart
reviews.reviewText: We switched to Huggies Natural Care because they are half the price and come in huge boxes, instead of having to tear open each package to refill the wipe warmer...After 1 month I’ve decided to switch back to Pampers Aqua Pure, we use these while we are out and sometimes in other parts of the house for spontaneous diaper changes or when we don’t feel like going into the Nursery for a change.I noticed that I need 1-2 pampers wipes instead of the 3-5 I use of Huggies wipes.They wipe and grab poop better because they are not too soft and don’t fall apart like Huggies.Even my husband said he noticed the Pampers do a better job of wiping.Also let’s address the scent of Huggies Natural Care Wipes, they have an odd smell whereas Pampers Pure has no odor whatsoever.Just like the other reviews I desperately need the to sell these in bulk because the package waste is absolutely annoying and ridiculous when you mainly use them in a wipe warmer or container you refill.I have tried water wipes, they are okay but not continuous feed. I also dislike water wipes packaging as it’s very inconvenient.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nothing beats old fashioned cloth diapers. soft and dry from the wind and Oh they smelled so good.
reviews.reviewText: I had my babies in 1858/1961. No such thing as disposible. Wash in the washing machine in the early A.M. hang them on the line outside and then bring them in as soon as they are dry, early afternoon, so they don't get wet again in the early afternoon rain. We used wash cloths. Imagine that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great wipes. No rash
reviews.reviewText: No rash on my baby. Durable and stay very moist.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best wipes for sensitive bottoms & faces!
reviews.reviewText: We’ve been using Pampers Sensitive Skin Wipes on my son for the last 4 1/2 years. When I seen these Pampers water wipes for sensitive skin, I decided to try them. I believe these are even better than the regular sensitive wipes. They are much more wet but with the same thickness and durability of the regular sensitive wipes. My son has broken out from other wipes, even other name brand sensitive skin wipes. So we are loyal Pampers users. My son is autistic and wears a pull up so we still use baby wipes and will for awhile. The great thing about these is that they can also be used to clean the face when needed, without causing a little rash on his face like the regular sensitive wipes did. These are the best! Priced the same as Walmart but easier to purchase via Amazon Prime and having the subscribe & save option is even better!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect amount of moisture, good on sensitive skin, perfect sized packages!
reviews.reviewText: These are the best wipes we have tried, out of about 11 other kinds for sensitive skin that we've tried since our daughter was born 14.5 months ago. They have the perfect amount of moisture to easily clean a baby or toddler's privates and bum. They are sensitive enough for most poop and rashes, but not really bad ones where a parent has neglected to catch or change the diarrhea for too long - then there is a slight sting. I just use paper towels moistened with luke warm water and lightly dab, for those rarer times. These wipes are truly fragrance-free/healthier/have less chemicals than most other so-called sensitive skin brands. They are average sized wipes not larger wipes, but not too small. They're easy to pull out of the container, and I love that the size isn't too bulky - they're the perfect height size and weight for traveling, for diaper bags, and even at home, for easy grabbing. I would definitely recommend these! They're worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars They are as advertised and work great.
reviews.reviewText: We liked that they will work for the things we bought them for. Cleans up makeup, cleans up after small spills without leaving any stickiness or residue, good as handy wipes in truck, good for babies but too. Very satisfied!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Favorite Wipes - VERY soft & retains moisture in a wipe warmer
reviews.reviewText: These are my favorite wipes. We have tried several different brands (even different Pampers wipes) and these are my most favorite. They are incredibly soft; they feel like a thin cloth vs a wipe. They also hold moisture well. We use a wipe warmer and this is the only wipe where I don't have to add water to the wipe warmer to keep them from drying out. My only complaint is when pulling out a wipe you'll get 2-3 at once, which is annoying when you're trying to use one hand while using your other hand to hold down your baby. This is an issue with plenty of brands, though, and the only downside to these otherwise amazing wipes. I have tried other brands to try and avoid this issue and have literally had other wipes cause diaper rash on my baby (rash goes away after 24 hours of switching BACK to these wipes). We no longer buy any other wipe but Pampers Aqua Pure for diaper changes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Ideal for pee diapers!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love how soft, gentle, and moist these are. I also love the fact that they are fragrance free as babies have sensitive skin. They work great with my wipe warmer as well. That being said, they are ideal for pee diapers...I find that they are so soft and smooth that they kind of just smear the poop around rather than gripping it and wiping it away. I really like the seventh generation free and clear wipes for wiping away poo. I find them to be more thick and textured with a design that really just grips the poop and wipes it away with ease.
I love this for my son..I order it every month and they last for awhile!
